medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was first diagnosed with hypertension at age 48, presenting with nausea and headache. Her blood pressure was persistently high (180/110 mmHg) despite multiple antihypertensive medications and severe hypokalemia (2.1 mEq/L). In 2008, she presented again with nausea, vomiting, headache, and elevated blood pressure (250/130 mmHg).
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent left adrenalectomy after workup for adrenal adenoma related to her primary aldosteronism. She has a history of renal function impairment, progressing to end-stage renal disease (ESRD).
medical_history.family_history: All ten siblings and five sons were hypertensive.
